oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-11-29 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 29, 1958. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ferlin Husky (host/performer) who also performs as Simon Crum, guest performer Leon McAuliffe, and regular performers the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, June Carter, and Floyd Cramer. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 999th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: June Carter; Leon McAuliffe; Floyd Cramer; Simon Crum
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Ferlin Husky introduces June Carter -- Comedy routine (June Carter, Ferlin Husky) -- Prince Albert commercial (June Carter, Ferlin Husky) -- Prince Albert jingle -- Ferlin Husky introduces Leon McAuliffe -- Steel Guitar Rag (Leon McAuliffe) -- Ferlin Husky introduces Floyd Cramer -- Rumpus (Floyd Cramer) -- Ferlin Husky and Grant Turner introduce Simon Crum -- Country Music Is Here To Stay (Simon Crum) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Ferlin Husky) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial -- Station announcements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Cash, June Carter, 1929-2003; Atkins, Chet; Cramer, Floyd, 1933-1997; Jackson, Tommy; Jordanaires (Musical group); Husky, Ferlin; McAuliffe, Leon, 1917-1988
